main event: A bright orange object, the size of a small button, was sighted performing erratic, rapid, and 360-degree flight over Yakima, Washington on July 7, 1959.
interesting points: The object was described as wavering and erratic in its flight pattern.
The object was initially thought to be a possible meteor due to its flight characteristics.
Multiple unidentified flying objects, described as red, green, white, and blue, were reported hovering with flickering lights in the Yakima, Washington area during July and August 1959.
An investigation by the 25th Air Division at McChord Air Force Base determined the sightings were of normal aircraft conducting routine missions in the area.
sighted object: a bright orange object the size of a small button
